view

Class Renderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Canvas
        • view.Renderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Renderer
extends java.awt.Canvas
    Responsible for rendering images, text and particle emitters to a canvas. User has to queue objects he wants to render every frame and call the repaint method afterwards.
    Author:
    Tadas
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Renderer

        public Renderer()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes the renderer. Has to be called before renderer can be used. Has to be called after the window is visible, which is why this method is not part of the constructor.

      • repaint

        public void repaint()
        This has to be called every frame to make the window update. Uses double buffering internally.
        Overrides:
        repaint in class java.awt.Component

      • registerButton

        public void registerButton(Button b)

        Parameters:
        b - Button

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Renders all the queued objects every frame. Renderables are sorted based on their depth levels and then rendered. Text objects are rendered on top and finally the particle emitters get rendered.
        Overrides:
        paint in class java.awt.Canvas

      • getMetrics

        public java.awt.FontMetrics getMetrics(Text t)
        Returns the font metric of the supplied text object. Used for alligning the text objects.
        Parameters:
        t - Text object
        Returns:

      • setDefaultFontName

        public void setDefaultFontName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets a default font name to be used on fonts that don't have any other font name specified.
        Parameters:
        name - Default font name
